facts_summary: ElizaOS v2 is in beta testing with significant improvements over v1, showcasing AI model integration progress alongside substantial GitHub development activity including plugin system restructuring and API enhancements.
stories_analyzed: Shaw Makesmagic declared Gemini as "the best model in the world right now" and noted many developers have quietly switched to it in Cursor.
A new workflow combining ChatGPT 4o for image generation with VibeRig for 3D model conversion was shared by @dankvr and described as "50% faster" than previous manual approaches.
ElizaOS announced "Agent-led entertainment goes live" featuring autonomous MetaHuman entertainers using Unreal Engine, ElizaOS, and Livepeer.

Shaw Makesmagic argued that investment regulations limiting startup investments to those earning over $300k/year should be "abolished yesterday" to democratize access to private investment opportunities.
Development efforts in May focused on enhancing the core architecture and plugin ecosystem, including CLI improvements, plugin management system streamlining, and database operation refinements.
A significant restructuring of the plugin system is underway, with several plugins being moved to standalone repositories to support plugin sharing between v0.x and v1.x versions.

ElizaOS v2 is in beta testing and described as substantially different from v1 ("like day and night"). Users discussed mobile development challenges, auto.fun API limitations, and token tracking mechanisms.
Users troubleshooted ElizaOS v2 implementation issues, including Supabase database setup, custom plugin development challenges, and Twitter integration problems.

evaluations.prompt_used:
Create an illustration for a tech news magazine.

CHARACTERS (use reference sheet for exact appearance):
- ELIZA: Eliza is a stylized 3D anime-like young woman with a confident, playful, slightly teasing vibe, often posing with expressive hand gestures as if presenting, reacting, or joking.

SCENE: Eliza stands in silhouette beneath a towering tree bursting with fresh spring leaves, sunlight slicing through branches in vivid beams. Behind her, scattered laptop screens and code-laden papers hint at feverish progress, while her posture radiates hopeful anticipation and determination amid the electric energy of renewal.

ART STYLE: Conceptual New Yorker/Monocle style with bold shapes and visual metaphors. Hand-crafted feel with visible brushstrokes.

REQUIREMENTS:
- Characters must match reference sheet EXACTLY (colors, costume, features)
- Dynamic composition suitable for editorial use
- Professional quality illustration
- No text or watermarks
- Scene should feel natural and engaging

casual.name: Casual Scroller
casual.reaction: The colors are vibrant and the nature-meets-tech aesthetic is really eye-catching for a quick scroll.

invested.name: Community Member
invested.reaction: Great visual metaphor for the ElizaOS ecosystem expanding like a tree with all the core integrations like GitHub and Discord represented.

technical.name: Developer
technical.reaction: It's a bit of an abstract 'circuit tree' cliché, but I appreciate seeing the GitHub and code snippets on the screens to signal it's a dev project.

newcomer.name: First-Time Visitor
newcomer.reaction: This looks like some kind of open-source coding project involving AI or virtual characters, which makes me want to find out what the logos mean.

evaluations.prompt_used:

invested.name: Community Member

evaluations.prompt_used:
Create a professional data visualization for a tech news publication.

VISUALIZATION TYPE: 1. Visualization type: Flow chart  
2. Data points/categories: Core architecture enhancements, CLI improvements, plugin management streamlining, database operation refinements, plugin system restructuring, plugins moving to standalone repos, plugin sharing (v0.x ↔ v1.x)  
3. Flow/relationship direction: Sequential flow from development efforts to specific enhancements, branching to plugin restructuring and resulting outcomes  
4. Suggested section headers: May Development Focus, Architecture & Core Improvements, Plugin Ecosystem Changes, Version Compatibility

CONTENT CONTEXT:
Development efforts in May focused on enhancing the core architecture and plugin ecosystem, including CLI improvements, plugin management system streamlining, and database operation refinements. A significant restructuring of the plugin system is underway, with several plugins being moved to standalone repositories to support plugin sharing between v0.x and v1.x versions.

STYLE: Professional infographic/dashboard style - Sankey diagrams, charts, isometric data displays. Clean editorial quality.

REQUIREMENTS:
- Professional infographic/dashboard quality
- Clean, polished vector aesthetic
- Include section headers and labels where appropriate
- Strategic use of color to highlight key insights
- Editorial publication quality
- Modern, sophisticated design, professional infographic, data visualization, clean vector design, editorial quality

casual.name: Casual Scroller
casual.reaction: Looks like a professional software roadmap, but there's a lot of text to digest for a quick scroll.

invested.name: Community Member
invested.reaction: This is exactly the breakdown I needed to understand the migration to standalone repositories and how v0 and v1 will work together.

technical.name: Developer
technical.reaction: The diagram logically represents common architectural challenges like dependency decoupling and API contracts without using fluffy AI buzzwords.

newcomer.name: First-Time Visitor
newcomer.reaction: I can see that a tech project is being updated, but nothing here tells me what the software actually does for a user.

Significant restructuring of the plugin system is underway, with several plugins being moved to standalone repositories to support plugin sharing between v0.x and v1.x versions. - MARC: Marc is a friendly, upbeat half-human/half-cyborg character with a confident, playful vibe, often posed as if presenting, explaining, or joking with the viewer.

Vines entwine database icons, plugin symbols, and tiny Twitter birds as they collaboratively guide fresh shoots along a trellis, nurturing solutions into bloom.

patterns: Identity Confusion: First-time visitors consistently struggle to identify if the product is a game, a crypto token, or a coding tool.
Meme/Pop-Culture Dependency: Heavy reliance on Peanuts, Spartan, and Pepe characters engages casual scrollers but creates a brand identity crisis for professionals.
Text Overload: Technical progress images (GitHub/Beta Evidence) are failing the 'scroller' test due to high word counts and dense formatting.
The 'Decorative Code' Cliché: Developers are dismissive of 'abstract circuit trees' and 'floating gibberish' syntax, preferring functional diagrams.
improvements: Contextual Branding: Incorporate a consistent subtitle or 'Powered by ElizaOS' tag to ground the abstract art in its software identity.
Replace Text with Infographics: Convert text-heavy updates (like GitHub migration) into clean, high-contrast architectural diagrams with minimal labels.
Authentic Syntax: Replace 'decorative gibberish' code with actual snippets of the v2 configuration or plugin API to gain credibility with developers.
Persona-Specific Layering: Ensure 'Hero' shots focus on the aesthetic (Nature/Tech) while 'Update' shots prioritize UI/UX mockups over character mashups.
recommendations.strongest: overall.png (4.0/5). It achieved the highest consensus by successfully balancing a visual metaphor (the circuit tree) with enough technical context (GitHub/code snippet) to engage all four personas.
recommendations.weakest: github-updates.png and evidence-beta-progress.png (3.2/5). These images are too technical for casual readers to digest while simultaneously lacking the visual polish to clarify the product's purpose to newcomers.
recommendations.priority: Establish a clear 'Product Logic'—every illustration must contain a visual anchor (like a UI shell or a specific 'AI Agent' symbol) that immediately tells a first-time visitor this is an AI software project.
